meanings.definition: To surpass in rivalry or competition.
meanings.sent1: In the race, Sarah managed to outrival her opponents and reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: The team worked hard to outrival their competitors and win the championship.
meanings.sent3: At the baking contest, Mary's cake managed to outrival all the others with its delicious taste.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed allowed him to outrival all obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete trained tirelessly to outrival his own personal best record.

meanings.definition: To be more successful or impressive than someone else in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: Despite the tough competition, the new company managed to outrival the established businesses in the market.
meanings.sent2: Her artwork always had a unique quality that allowed it to outrival others in the art exhibition.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's attempt to outrival the birds in gathering nuts was both amusing and impressive.
meanings.sent4: The student's innovative project design managed to outrival all other submissions in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The singer's powerful voice never failed to outrival the other performers on stage.
